content:
Congratulations on adding a Zumba class to your routine! Fueling up with a nutritious lunch will definitely help you power through your workout. Here are some healthy lunch ideas that'll provide you with the energy you need:

**Protein-packed options:**

1. Grilled chicken breast with quinoa and roasted veggies
2. Turkey and avocado wrap with mixed greens and whole wheat tortilla
3. Lentil soup with whole grain bread and a side salad
4. Greek yogurt with berries, nuts, and a sprinkle of granola

**Complex carbs for sustained energy:**

1. Whole grain pita stuffed with roasted vegetables and hummus
2. Brown rice and black bean bowl with grilled chicken and salsa
3. Sweet potato and black bean tacos with mixed greens and avocado salsa
4. Oatmeal with banana, almond butter, and honey

**Healthy fats for sustained energy:**

1. Salmon salad sandwich on whole grain bread with avocado and mixed greens
2. Turkey and cheese wrap with avocado and mixed greens
3. Quinoa and black bean salad with grilled chicken, cherry tomatoes, and a citrus vinaigrette
4. Roasted vegetable and goat cheese wrap with mixed greens and whole wheat tortilla

**Hydrating options:**

1. Water-rich foods like cucumber, tomatoes, and melon, paired with a lean protein source
2. Infused water with fruits and herbs, like strawberry and mint or lemon and ginger

**Pre-workout snack ideas:**

1. Banana with almond butter and honey
2. Apple slices with peanut butter
3. Energy balls made with oats, nuts, and dried fruits
4. Greek yogurt with berries and honey

Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day, especially before and during your Zumba class. Aim to eat your lunch about 1-2 hours before your workout to allow for proper digestion. Enjoy your Zumba class and your healthy lunch!
